newsitem.title: GERMANY: SOCCER-LEVERKUSEN CRUSH TBLISI WITH 6-1 WIN.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-LEVERKUSEN CRUSH TBLISI WITH 6-1 WIN.

text.p: Germany's Bayer Leverkusen on Wednesday all but booked their place in the European Cup Champions' League with a 6-1 demolition of Georgia's Dynamo Tblisi.
Hans-Peter Lehnhoff and Carsten Ramelow put the German club on the road to victory, giving them a 2-0 halftime lead in the preliminary round first-leg game.
Strikers Erik Meijer and Ulf Kirsten put the match beyond doubt with a goal apiece early in the second half.

Meijer added a second in the 62nd minute after Alexander Iashvili had given the Georgian champions a glimmer of hope by sending a curling shot past Dirk Heinen in the Leverkusen goal. Substitute Paulo Rink made it 6-1 five minutes from time.
